author: Special Correspondent
text:
Country boat fishermen say it will destroy their livelihood

Fishermen from the coastal villages of the district have urged the State government to withdraw the latest amendment it made to the Tamil Nadu Marine Fishing Regulation Act, 1983, “as it will destroy the livelihood of country boat fishermen”.

In a petition submitted at the Collector’s office here on Friday, a group of fishermen from a few coastal hamlets in the district said that the country boat fishermen, who were using rows till three decades ago, had fitted outboard engines with capacity ranging from 8 HP to 40 HP in their boats.

These kerosene-powered engines were being used only for manoeuvring the boats from the coast to the fishing spots in the sea and not for trolling purposes, for which these engines of lower capacity could not be used.

Moreover, the country boat fishermen could not carry out deep sea fishing owing to the smaller size of the craft and lesser capacity of engines.
title: “Withdraw amendment to fishing Act”
